Description: Wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) pottery bowl; interior: glaze fired orange; dot- rosette in white; three red bands; incised lotus flower with added colour; exterior: cream slip; perhaps pendant lotus at top, bands with added colour, framing key maeander frieze below; inscription cut on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd preserves the end of the dedication to Apollo found on 1886,0401.986-988, and is a loose fragment of that piece.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.280)
